page.title: 01Introduction to Park Cross.
page.content: The area is mostly{farmland}and it lies between the villages of Carisbrooke and Calbourne.To the South there are the Downs which are formed of chalk. Part of Parkhurst Forest is to be found to the North-East of the area.There is more woodland to the West.Most of the land in the centre of the area is fields. Except for a small residential area to the East there are very few houses at all.Through the middle of our area there are the remains of an old railway. Most of the farms are livestock, but there is one large arable farm. Several of the farmhouses are at least two hundred years old, but the oldest and most interesting building is Swainston Manor. The only{industry}is a printing and card manufacturing works. Two main roads to the West Wight cross the area.
